fields.name: Creation
fields.description: Genesis Chapter 1 In the beginning GOD created the heaven and the earth - Genesis 1:1. GOD have made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their host; the earth and everything on it; the seas and all that is in them - Nehemiah 9:6. GOD created every living creature.

fields.name: Adam And Eve
fields.description: Genesis 2:7-8, 18-25 GOD created human beings in His image; male and female created He them - Genesis 1:27. The 'man' GOD named Adam. GOD created 'woman' from Adam's rib - Genesis 2:22. Adam called his wife's name Eve; because she was the mother of all living - Genesis 3:20.

fields.name: Noah And The Ark
fields.description: Genesis Chapter 7 People became exceedingly wicked and GOD wanted to destroy them all with a flood. However, Noah and his family still obeyed GOD. So GOD told Noah to build a very large boat into which GOD brought all the living creatures to be saved from destruction. Noah, his family and the animals on board the Ark were the only ones to survive the great flood.

fields.name: Abraham And The Three Visitors
fields.description: Genesis 18:1-2 While Abraham was sitting near the entrance to his tent near the great tree at Mamre, he looked up and saw three men standing nearby. Abraham bowed down and said, 'Let me bring you water to wash your feet and then rest here while I bring you food. When you are refreshed you can then go on your way.'

fields.name: Sarah And Isaac
fields.description: Genesis 21:1-7 GOD promised Abraham and Sarah, 'progeny'. Sarah was ninety years of age when she conceived her son, Isaac - Genesis 17:17. GOD keeps his promise to Abraham. Therefore, Abraham and Sarah had a son named Isaac.

fields.name: Abraham Sacrifices Isaac
fields.description: Genesis 22:6-12 GOD tests Abraham's faith by asking him to sacrifice his beloved son, Isaac. Abraham in faith goes ahead but GOD intervenes so that Isaac is unharmed; having seen that Abraham was indeed, totally obedient to GOD. GOD then provides a ram for sacrifice instead.

fields.name: Baby Moses In An Ark Of Bulrushes
fields.description: Exodus 2:1-3 Pharaoh wanted all the male children of the Israelites killed. So, Jochebed, the mother of Moses (Exodus 6:20, Numbers 26:59), placed Moses into an ark of bulrushes. Then she placed the ark on the river Nile and Moses' sister, Miriam, followed it to see what would happen to Moses.

fields.name: Moses Discovered By The Daughter Of Pharaoh
fields.description: Exodus 2:1-10 Pharaoh's daughter discovered the ark of bulrushes with Moses in it. So, she adopted Moses and he grew up in Pharaoh's household.

fields.name: Moses At The Burning Bush
fields.description: Exodus 3:1-6 GOD spoke to Moses through an angel in a bush that was on fire. Even though the bush was on fire, the leaves were not consumed! GOD called to Moses from the midst of the bush and said, 'Moses, Moses!' And he said, 'Here I am.' Then GOD said, 'I am the GOD of your father - the GOD of Abraham, the GOD of Isaac, and the GOD of Jacob.'

fields.name: Blood On The Two Doorposts And The Lintels
fields.description: Exodus 12:1-7 At the eve of the first ever Passover, the Israelites placed blood on the lintels and the two doorposts of their houses, so that the tenth plague, the death of the firstborn, would not affect their homes.

fields.name: The Crossing Of The Red Sea
fields.description: Exodus 14:21-22, 29-31 The Israelites had walked on dry land in the midst of the Red Sea; the waters were a wall to them on their right hand and on their left.

fields.name: The Army Of Pharaoh Drowned In The Red Sea
fields.description: Exodus 14:26-31 Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the sea returned to its full depth, while Pharaoh's army were fleeing into it. Then the waters returned and covered the chariots, the horsemen, and all the army of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them. Not so much as one of them remained.

fields.name: Timbrels And Dancing
fields.description: Exodus 15:1-21 The women sang praises to GOD and danced before GOD whilst playing timbrels. They rejoiced because of how GOD had saved Israel from Pharaoh's army.

fields.name: Ark Of The Covenant
fields.description: Exodus 25:10-22 The Ark of the Covenant represented the presence and glory of GOD both in the Tabernacle in the wilderness and in the Temple at Jerusalem.

fields.name: The Ten Commandments
fields.description: Exodus 31:18, 32:15-16, 34:28 The Ten Commandments were the principal ten rules that the Israelites had to obey as instructed by GOD.

fields.name: The Spies And The Cluster Of Grapes
fields.description: Numbers 13:23 When chosen Israelites went to 'spy out' the Promised Land they brought back a cluster of grapes as a sample of the produce of the land.

fields.name: Joshua At Jericho
fields.description: Joshua Chapter 6 The city of Jericho was surrounded by impregnable walls. So the Israelites marched seven times around the city and after the seventh march, they blew their trumplets and the walls came crumbling down.

fields.name: Jesus Blessed By Simeon
fields.description: Luke 2:25-35 Now there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon, who was righteous and devout. He was waiting for the promised Saviour (Messiah) as the holy spirit had revealed that he would not see death before he had seen GOD's Christ (GOD's Messiah).

fields.name: The Magi Pay Homage To Jesus
fields.description: Matthew 2:1-12 After Jesus had been born in Bethlehem, during the reign of King Herod, wise men from the east set off for Jerusalem with gifts. These men were called Magi, who had seen a bright new star appear, signalling a newborn king, and wanted to pay homage to him.

fields.name: Jesus' Baptism
fields.description: Matthew 3:13-17, Mark 1:9-11, Luke 3:21-22, John 1:29-34 Jesus went from Galilee to the River Jordan to be baptised by John the Baptist. When John saw Jesus he did not want to baptise him. 'This is not proper,' he said. 'I am the one who needs to be baptised by you.' But Jesus insisted, 'Please do it, for I must do all that is right.' So John baptised Jesus.

fields.name: Miracles: Two Blind Men
fields.description: Matthew 9:27-31, 20:29-34 Then Jesus touched their eyes saying, 'Let it be done for you according to your faith.' And their eyes were opened.

fields.name: Zacchaeus
fields.description: Luke 19:1-10 Zacchaeus was trying to get a look at Jesus, but being a short man he could not see over the crowd. So he ran on ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, because Jesus was going to pass that way. And when Jesus came to that place, he looked up and said to him, 'Zacchaeus, come down quickly, because I must stay at your house today.'

fields.name: Miracles: Woman With The Stooped Back
fields.description: Luke 13:10-17 Now whilst Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath, a woman came to him who had been disabled with a stooped back for eighteen years. Jesus said, 'Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.' Then he placed his hands on her and immediately she straightened up and praised GOD.

fields.name: Miracles: The Resurrection Of Lazarus
fields.description: John 11:1-44 John 11:35 is the shortest verse in the Bible. It reads, 'Jesus wepts'. Nonetheless, Jesus prayed 'Father, I thank you that you have listened to me.' When Jesus had said this, he shouted in a loud voice. 'Lazarus, come out!' Lazarus came out, his feet and hands tied up with strips of cloth, and a cloth wrapped around his face. Jesus said to them, 'Unwrap him and let him go.'

fields.name: The Samaritan Neighbour
fields.description: Luke 10:29-37 Jesus told this parable after a lawyer regarding the Law of Moses asked him, 'Who is my neighbour?' A man going from Jerusalem to Jericho is attacked by robbers who strip him and beat him. Both a priest and a Levite on two different occasions passed by on the other side of the road without helping him. But a Samaritan stops and cares for him, taking him to an inn where the Samaritan pays for his care. After telling this parable Jesus asked, 'Which one of these three people was a real neighbour to the man who was beaten up by robbers?' The lawyer answered, 'The one who showed mercy.' Jesus said, 'Go and do likewise!'

fields.name: Miracles: Jesus Heals The Lame Man At The Pool Of Bethesda
fields.description: John 5:1-16 Lying by the pool was a man had been an invalid for thirty-eight years. Jesus commanded the man, 'Get up, pick up your mat and walk.' The man obeyed Jesus and was completely healed. Jesus stepped away in the crowds as many looked on in amazement.

fields.name: Miracles: Jesus Heals The Lame Man Brought To Him Through A Roof
fields.description: Mark 2:1-12, Luke 5:17-26 Four men arrived bringing a paralysed friend they wanted Jesus to heal. But the crowd around the house was so big they had no chance of getting inside. The men then started clawing at the mud plaster and wood of the roof of the house to make a hole in the roof. The men then started clawing at the mud plaster and wood to make a hole in the roof. Those below saw the hole appear and get bigger until it was large enough for the paralysed man to be lowered on his bed mat to Jesus. Jesus said to the paralysed man, 'Son, your sins are forgiven. Get up, pick up your mat and go home.' Immediately the man stood up and went home praising God.

fields.name: Jesus Looks Up To Heaven And Gives Thanks
fields.description: Mark 6:41, Luke 9:16, John 6:11 Jesus took the five barley loaves and a couple of fish; he looked up to heaven and gave thanks to GOD. Then Jesus broke off pieces for his disciples to set before the crowd.

fields.name: Jesus Feeding The 5000
fields.description: Matthew 14:13-21, Mark 6:32-44, Luke 9:12-17, John 6:1-14 Jesus feeds a crowd of over 5000 people with just five barley loaves and a couple of fish.

fields.name: Jesus Cleansing The Temple
fields.description: Matthew 21:12-17, Mark 11:15-19, Luke 19:45-48 Jesus exclaimed. 'Is it not written, that GOD's house will be called a house of prayer? But you have turned it into a den of robbers.' Jesus overturned the tables of the corrupt money changers. He overturned the benches of those selling doves. Jesus drove out all who were buying or selling and stopped anyone carrying goods through the Temple courts.

fields.name: Jesus At The Passover Meal
fields.description: Matthew 26:17-20, Mark 14:12-17, Luke 22:7-14 Now it was Passover and Jesus know exactly what was going to happen to him. He went into the upper room of a house with his disciples to celebrate the Passover meal.

fields.name: Eat The Bread, It Is The Body Of Jesus
fields.description: Matthew 26:26, Mark 14:22, Luke 22:19, 1 Corinthians 11:23-24,26 Jesus takes bread, gives thanks, breaks it and gives it to his disciples, saying, 'Take and eat, this is my body given for you. Do this in remembrance of me.'

fields.name: Drink The Wine, It Is The Blood Of Jesus
fields.description: Matthew 26:27-29, Mark 14:23-25, Luke 22:17-18,20; 1 Corinthians 11:25-26 Jesus takes a cup, and gives thanks, saying, 'Drink from it, all of you. This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.'

fields.name: Gethsemane
fields.description: Matthew 26:36-46, Mark 14:32-42 At the Garden of Gethsemane, Jesus says to his disciples, 'Sit here while I go over there and pray.' Jesus is deeply distressed. Jesus prays, three times, 'My Father, if it is possible, may this cup be taken from me. Yet not as I will, but as you will.'

fields.name: Jesus With A Crown of Thorns Being Hit By Soldiers
fields.description: John 19:1-3 The soldiers mockingly dressed Jesus in a purple robe and put a crown of thorns on his head. Then the soldiers ridiculed and hit Jesus.

fields.name: The Soldiers Mock Jesus
fields.description: Matthew 27:29-30, Mark 15:17-20 The soldiers clothed Jesus in a robe. They came up to him again and again and said, 'Hail, King of the Jews!' And they struck him repeatedly in the face.

fields.name: Jesus Mocked At His Crucifixion
fields.description: Mark 15:29-32 The Chief Priests and elders mocked, 'He saved others but he cannot save himself.'

fields.name: Jesus Has Been Raised! The Women Run To Tell The Good News
fields.description: Luke 24:1-10 When the women arrived at the tomb they saw two men in shining garments. The men said 'Why do you seek the living among the dead? Jesus is not here, but has been raised!' So the women hurried away and told all these things to the eleven disciples.

fields.name: Peter And John Visit The Empty Tomb
fields.description: Luke 24:12, John 20:1-10 Peter and John had to see for themselves. They both ran to the tomb. They saw the empty clothes, but it was true - Jesus was gone! They went back, puzzled over what had happened.

fields.name: Mary Magdalene And The Two Angels
fields.description: John 20:11-12 Mary Magdalene stayed at the tomb crying. Two angels asked her, 'Why are you crying?' 'They have taken Jesus away,' she said, 'and I do not know where they have have put him.'

fields.name: Jesus And The Two On The Road To Emmaus
fields.description: Mark 16:12-13, Luke 24:13-32 While two men were walking on the road to Emmaus, a stranger began to walk with them. 'Why are you so sad?' he asked. 'All these things are written in the Bible.' The stranger told them how everything that had happened to Jesus was part of GOD's plan. When they got to their house they invited the stranger in for a meal. He took the bread, broke it and gave it to them. Then the stranger disappeared! At that moment, the two men knew they had seen Jesus! Jesus is Alive!

fields.name: The Resurrected Jesus Shows His Disciples, His Pierced Hands And Feet
fields.description: Luke 24:36-40 Jesus came and stood among them and said, 'Peace be with you.' When Jesus had said this he showed them his hands and his feet. Then the disciples rejoiced when they realised it was indeed Jesus their Lord, whom GOD raised from the dead.

fields.name: The Resurrected Jesus Eats Fish And Honeycomb
fields.description: Luke 24:41-43 Jesus suddenly out of nowhere stood before his disciples. The disciples were full of joy and amazement but still thought they were seeing a ghost. 'Do you have anything here to eat?' Jesus asked. The disciples gave him, a piece of broiled fish and some honeycomb, and Jesus ate as they watched. They now knew they were not seeing a ghost. Jesus is Alive! Jesus has indeed been raised from the dead!

fields.name: The 153 Fishes
fields.description: John 21:1-14 The disciples after fishing all night caught nothing! In the morning, a stranger on the shore said to them, 'Throw your net on the right side of the boat and you will catch some fish.' They did as they were told and caught so many fish they could not pull the net back into the boat. It was at that moment that the disciples realised that it was Jesus who was on the shore. There were one hundred and fifty-three fishes in the net yet the net had not broken. This is now the third time Jesus showed himself to his disciples after he was raised from the dead.

fields.name: Jesus' Ascension
fields.description: Acts 1:9-11 During the forty days after Jesus was raised from the dead by GOD, Jesus proved in many ways that he was actually alive. Jesus talked to them about the Kingdom of GOD. Jesus instructs his disciples to stay in Jerusalem until the arrival of the holy spirit. After saying this, Jesus was taken up into a cloud. As the disciples strained to see him rising into heaven, two white-robed men suddenly stood among them. 'Men of Galilee,' they said, 'why are you standing here staring into heaven? Jesus has been taken from you into heaven, but someday he will return from heaven in the same way you saw him go!'

fields.name: Pentecost
fields.description: Acts 2:1-21 On the day of Pentecost all the believers were meeting together in one place in Jerusalem. Suddenly, there was a sound from heaven like the roaring of a mighty windstorm. Then, what looked like flames or tongues of fire appeared and settled on each of them. Everyone present was filled with the holy spirit and began speaking in other languages, as the holy spirit gave them this ability.

fields.name: Lame Man At The Gate Called Beautiful
fields.description: Acts 3:1-11 Then Peter said to the lame man, 'Look at us!' So the man gave them his attention, expecting to get something from them. Then Peter said, 'Silver or gold I do not have, but what I do have I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk.' Taking him by the right hand, he helped him up, and instantly the man's feet and ankles became strong. He jumped to his feet and began to walk. Then he went with them into the temple courts, walking and jumping, and praising GOD.

fields.name: Philip And The Ethiopian
fields.description: Acts 8:27-39 Philip ran up to the chariot and heard a man, who was an Ethiopian official, reading Isaiah the prophet. 'Do you understand what you are reading?' Philip asked. 'How can I,' he said, 'unless someone explains it to me?' So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him. The man was reading from Isaiah Chapter 53. The official asked Philip, 'Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?' Then Philip using that passage of Scripture told him the Gospel regarding Jesus. The offical believed the Gospel and when they came to some water, both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water and Philip baptised him.

fields.name: Saul's Conversion
fields.description: Acts 9:1-22, 22:1-16, 26:1-19 When Saul was almost at Damascus a bright light from heaven flashed around him. Saul fell to the ground and then heard a strange thing, a voice from heaven saying 'Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?' Saul said, 'Who are you, Lord?' The voice answered, 'I am Jesus whom you are persecuting; but rise,and it will be told you what you must do.' Saul became a Christian! Jesus in a vision spoke to Ananias, who as instructed prayed for Saul's sight to be restored and then Ananias baptised Saul. Saul began proclaiming that Jesus was the Son of GOD. People were amazed that the man that once persecuted Christians was now preaching faith in Jesus Christ.

fields.name: The Dream Of Peter
fields.description: Acts 10:9-16, 11:1-10 Peter fell into a trance while resting on Simon's rooftop. He saw heaven open and a large sheet filled with unclean animals, reptiles, and birds. A voice instructed him to kill and eat, but Peter refused. The voice repeated this three times, and the sheet was returned to heaven. During this time, messengers from Cornelius arrived. Cornelius was a GOD-fearing man. He was a 'non-Jew', that is, a Gentile. When Peter met Cornelius, Peter explained that it was against Jewish law for a Jew to visit a Gentile, but GOD had shown him not to call anyone impure. Peter then preaches the Gospel. Cornelius and his household became Christians, and Peter baptised them in the name of Jesus Christ. Acts Chapter 10.

fields.name: The Baptism Of Lydia
fields.description: Acts 16:11-15 Lydia was a merchant of expensive purple cloth, who worshipped GOD. As she listened to Paul share the Gospel about the kingdom of GOD and about Jesus, GOD opened her heart, and she became a Christian. She was baptised along with other members of her household.

fields.name: The Baptism Of The Philippian Jailer
fields.description: Acts 16:23-34 The Philippian jailer was ordered to prevent Paul and Silas from escaping, so they were placed in an inner dungeon. At midnight, they were praying and singing hymns when an earthquake shook the prison, breaking the chains of every prisoner. The jailer, trembling, asked Paul and Silas, 'Sirs, what must I do to be saved?'. They replied to believe in the Lord Jesus. Paul and Silas then shared the Gospel with the jailer and his household. The jailer washed their wounds. Then the jailer and everyone in his household were baptised.
